title: After filing for divorce, can I be held responsible for my legal husband's DUI accident settlement fines?
question: I filed for divorce and because my spouse did not hire an attorney and my attorney was being treated for cancer without assigning my case to anyone else, the divorce was not finalized for over a year. During this time my legal spouse was the driver in a car accident while under the influence of alcohol. In his car was a woman who was hospitalized. She first was sueing me for liability. Then after the divorce was fianalized she changed the suit to say that I conspired with my ex-husband.to have the divorce settlement give me all the cash from my personal injury case, that I am still ,after 7 years, on disability from. I have documentation showing the allocation of money was set up prior to their accident and my ex was not expecting more money since I supported our 3 children.
answers:
No you should not be held responsible for your husband’s debt after the divorce. She would have a restitution order from the court against your husband to pay. Either your husband will eventually pay or end up in jail for failure to pay.
Robert Driessen

Once you filed for divorce you have no legal liability for your spouse's debts. However, if you were owner of the car in the accident you may be liable for up to $15,000 in damages. If you had car insurance they should have been notified to handle.
